title: NACC Uniform Data Set (UDS) – Initial Visit Packet, Form B9: Clinician Judgment of Symptoms
description:
NOTE: This form is to be completed by the clinician. For additional clarificationADC 
and examples, see UDS Coding Guidebook for Initial Visit Packet, Form B9.
Check only one box per question.

B9CHG.title: 0Z
B9CHG.description: Indicate whether the information has changed since the previous UDS visit by checking only one of the three boxes below and following the corresponding instructions:
B9CHG.comment: Skips If 1 (first box is checked), end form here. If 3 (third box is checked), complete only questions 4, 7, and 10.
enum: 1 There have been no meaningful changes in the subject’s cognition, behavior, or motor function since the previous UDS visit. (If this box is checked, end form here.)

2 At the previous UDS visit, the clinician DID NOT report a decline in the subject’s memory, non-memory cognitive abilities, behavior, or motor function (i.e., question 3a = ‘0’). However, there have been meaningful changes since then. (If this box is checked, complete this entire form.)

3 At the previous UDS visit, the clinician DID report a decline in the subject’s memory, non-memory cognitive abilities, behavior, or motor function (i.e., question 3a = ‘1’). Since then, there have been additional meaningful changes.(If this box is checked, complete questions 4, 7, and 10 only.)

DECSUB.title: 1 Does the subject report a decline in memory relative to previously attained abilities?

DECIN.title: 2 Does the informant report a decline in subject’s memory relative to previously attained abilities?

DECCLIN.title: 3A Does the clinician believe there has been a current meaningful decline in the subject’s memory, non-memory cognitive abilities, behavior, or ability to manage his/her affairs?
DECCLIN.description: Skips If no, end form here.

DECAGE.title: 3B At what age did the decline begin (based upon the clinician’s assessment)?

indicate_impair.title:
4.Has there been a meaningful decline in the subject’s usual abilities for any
of the following?:

COGMEM.title: 4A Memory (For example, does s/he forget conversations and/or dates; repeat questions and/or statements; misplace more than usual; forget names of people s/he knows well?)

COGJUDG.title: 4B Judgment and problem-solving (For example, does s/he have trouble handling money (tips); paying bills; shopping; preparing meals; handling appliances; handling medications; driving?)

COGLANG.title: 4C Language (For example, does s/he have hesitant speech; have trouble finding words; use inappropriate words without self-correction?)

COGVIS.title: 4D Visuospatial function (Difficulty interpreting visual stimuli and finding his/her way around).

COGATTN.title: 4E Attention/concentration (For example, does the subject have a short attention span or ability to concentrate? Is s/he easily distracted?)

COGOTHRX.title: 4F1 Cognitive symptoms, other – specify
COGOTHRX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“), ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%).Blank if #3A, DECCLIN = 0 (No), or if #4G, COGOTHR ≠ 1 (Yes).

COGFRST.title: 5 Indicate the predominant symptom which was first recognized as a decline in the subject’s cognition:

COGFRSTX.title: 5A First predominant cognitive symptom, other – specify
COGFRSTX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“), ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%).Blank if #3A, DECCLIN = 0 (No), or if #5, COGFRST ≠ 6 (Other).

COGMODE.title: 6 Mode of onset of cognitive symptoms:

COGMODEX.title: 6A Cognitive symptoms onset mode, other – specify
COGMODEX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“), ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%). Blank if #3A, DECCLIN = 0 (No) or if #6, COGMODE ≠ 4 (Other).

indicate_beha_symp.title: 7.Which of the following meaningful changes in behavior have been present during the course of the illness?

BEAPATHY.title: 7A Apathy/withdrawal (Has the subject lost interest in or displayed a reduced ability to initiate usual activities and social interaction, such as conversing with family and/or friends?)

BEDEP.title: 7B Depression (Has the subject seemed depressed for more than two weeks at a time; e.g., loss of interest or pleasure in nearly all activities, sadness, hopelessness, loss of appetite, fatigue?)

BEDISIN.title: 7D Disinhibition (Does the subject use inappropriate coarse language or exhibit inappropriate speech or behaviors in public or in the home? Does s/he talk personally to strangers or have disregard for personal hygiene?)

BEIRRIT.title: 7E Irritability (Does the subject overreact, such as shouting at family members or others?)

BEAGIT.title: 7F Agitation (Does the subject have trouble sitting still; does s/he shout, hit, and/or kick?)

BEPERCH.title: 7G Personality change (Does the subject exhibit bizarre behavior or behavior uncharacteristic of the subject, such as unusual collecting, suspiciousness [without delusions], unusual dress, or dietary changes? Does the subject fail to take other’s feeling into account?)

BEOTHRX.title: 7H1 Behavior symptoms, other – specify
BEOTHRX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“), ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%). Blank if #3A, DECCLIN = 0 (No), or if #7I, BEOTHR ≠ 1 (Yes).

BEFRST.title: 8 Indicate the predominant symptom which was first recognized as a decline in the subject’s behavioral symptoms:

BEFRSTX.title: 8A First predominant behavior symptom, other – specify
BEFRSTX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“), ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%). Blank if #3A, DECCLIN = 0 (No), or if #8, BEFRST ≠ 8 (Other).

BEMODE.title: 9 Mode of onset of behavioral symptoms:

BEMODEX.title: 9A Behavioral symptoms onset mode, other – specify
BEMODEX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“),ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%). Blank if #3A, DECCLIN = 0 (No), or if #9 BEMODE ≠ 4 (Other).

indicate_motor_symp.title:
10.Which of the following meaningful changes in motor function have been
present during the course of the illness?

MOGAIT.title: 10A Gait disorder (Has the subject’s walking changed, not specifically due to arthritis or an injury? Is s/he unsteady, or does s/he shuffle when walking, have little or no arm-swing, or drag a foot?)

MOFALLS.title: 10B Falls (Does the subject fall more than usual?)

MOTREM.title: 10C Tremor (Has the subject had rhythmic shaking, especially in the hands, arms, legs, head, mouth or tongue?)

MOSLOW.title: 10D Slowness (Has the subject noticeably slowed down in walking or moving or handwriting, other than due to an injury or illness? Has his/her facial expression changed, or become more “wooden” or masked and unexpressive?)

MOFRST.title: 11 Indicate the predominant symptom which was first recognized as a decline in the subject’s motor symptoms:

MOMODE.title: 12 Mode of onset of motor symptoms:

MOMODEX.title: 12X Motor symptoms onset mode, other – specify
MOMODEX.description: Any text or numbers but cannot use single quotes (‘), double quotes (“), ampersands (&), or percentage signs (%). Blank if #3A, DECCLIN = 0 (No), or if #12 MOMODE ≠ 4 (Other).

FRSTCHG.title: 14 Indicate the predominant domain which was first recognized as changed in the subject:

memo_comp.DECSUB.title: 1 Does the subject report a decline in memory relative to previously attained abilities?

memo_comp.DECIN.title: 2 Does the informant report a decline in subject’s memory relative to previously attained abilities?

memo_comp.DECCLIN.title: 3A Does the clinician believe there has been a current meaningful decline in the subject’s memory, non-memory cognitive abilities, behavior, or ability to manage his/her affairs, or have there been motor/movement changes relative to previously attained abilities?

memo_comp.DECAGE.title: 3B At what age did the cognitive decline begin (based upon the clinician’s assessment)?

motor_symp.MOMODE.title: 12 Mode of onset of motor symptoms:

motor_symp.MOMODEX.title: 12X Motor symptoms onset mode, other – specify
